Description:
**ScaleProTec‚Ñ¢** uses advanced **Template Assisted Crystallization (TAC)** technology to prevent scale buildup ‚Äî without salt, chemicals, or waste discharge.
The ScaleProTec‚Ñ¢ 32K combines salt-free scale prevention with premium carbon filtration, making it ideal for small households and condos. Using advanced media technology, it conditions water without chemicals or added sodium while reducing chlorine, taste, and odor. Enjoy cleaner, fresher water for drinking and cooking, plus protection against scale buildup on fixtures and appliances ‚Äî all with an eco-friendly, low-maintenance design.

Water Problems Solved:
**Prevents Scale Formation:** Transforms hardness minerals into stable crystals that won‚Äôt stick to pipes, heaters, or fixtures.
**No Salt or Chemicals:** Operates without brine, regeneration, or discharge ‚Äî environmentally responsible.
**Maintenance-Free:** No power, timers, or service cycles required; media typically lasts 3‚Äì5 years.
**Protects Equipment:** Extends life and efficiency of water heaters, dishwashers, and plumbing systems.

Extended Description:
Designed for compact households that value sustainability and performance, the Prime 32K uses FILTERSORB¬Æ SP3 media to neutralize hardness minerals, preventing scale formation without salt or waste. The carbon stage removes chlorine and odors, ensuring every tap delivers clean, refreshing water for drinking, bathing, and cooking.
Upgrade your home with smarter water technology and enjoy healthier water for your family and your home.
Protect your home from scale and chlorine ‚Äî choose ScaleProTec‚Ñ¢ Prime 32K today.

**Note:** ScaleProTec‚Ñ¢ is a _scale prevention system_, not a traditional water softener. Hardness remains measurable, but scale adhesion is minimized.
Installation Type: Indoor or Outdoor (Whole-House Point of Entry)
Estimated Installation Time: A professional ScaleProTec‚Ñ¢ system installation typically takes 2 to 4 hours, but this can vary depending on the complexity of the job and the type of system. Replacing an existing unit might take less time, sometimes as little as an hour, while a new installation with additional plumbing will take longer.¬†
